alert.note: Alert for Wilcox (Alabama) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 22 at 7:00PM CDT by NWS Mobile
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 9 PM CDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of south central Alabama, including the following county, Wilcox. * WHEN...Until 900 PM CDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 658 PM CDT, Doppler radar indicated slow moving thunderstorms producing very heavy rain over much of the advisory area. Radar estimates that between 1.5 and 2.5 inches of rain have quickly fallen with these storms during the past hour. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Camden, Shawnee, Estelle, Neenah, Darlington, Rosebud, Fatama, Oak Hill, Pebble Hill, Ackerville, Caledonia, Allenton, Rockwest, McBrydes, Millers Ferry and Snow Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
